Hi all.

I found this group via the excellent http://home.earthlink.net/
~j=
ggilbert/tsuba.htm and I was hoping you could tell me a bit about my 
first=
 tsuba. A relative picked it up at a flea market, hoping to mount 
it on a =
drawer, but now it's mine :-).

I've looked through the above site, but I'm=
 having trouble both dating 
it and determining the style. I know the leave=
s and flower are 
chrysanthemum, but that's about it. It's 85 mm (3.35 in) =
in diameter 
and weighs 96 gram (3.39 oz). I can't find any characters engr=
aved on 
either side or the rim. I'm guessing it's made of iron with patche=
s of 
gold leaf.

The link to the front is http://tinyurl.com/d9fvq and to =
the back is 
http://tinyurl.com/b6643 . My lack of photography skills is le=
gendary, 
 so please ignore the level differences and let me know if better=
 
pictures are required.

I doubt there's much market in my area for this t=
ype of item and I'm 
definitely keeping it for the novelty, but I'd be curi=
ous to know if 
it's worth 50 cents or 5 dollars.

That's all for now, than=
ks in advance for any comments.

Petter
